remarks: The domain of a mapping is a subset of its base classes expressed as union of Cartesian products over its second component, analogous to ~ dmmpt2ssx .  (Contributed by AV, 30-Mar-2019.)
statement:
dmmpt2ssx2.1 $e |- F = ( x e. A , y e. B |-> C ) $.
dmmpt2ssx2 $p |- dom F C_ U_ y e. B ( A X. { y } ) $.
$d A x $.
$d B x y $.
